items.title: The Spinoff presents SUPERPOD 2023
items.content:encoded:
SUPERPOD is back! Hosted by Gone By Lunchtime's Toby Manhire and featuring Jane Yee and Alex Casey from The Real Pod, Duncan Greive from The Fold, Gone By Lunchtime's Annabelle Lee-Mather, Simon Pound from Business Is Boring, Bernard Hickey from When The Facts Change and The Spinoff Podcast Network's Te Aihe Butler and Samuel Robinson, SUPERPOD 2023 is the crossover to end all crossovers. From intense discussion of government policy to figuring out what the heck a skibidi toilet is, we celebrate the best and worst of what has been a rollercoaster year.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: The final episode
items.content:encoded:
It's time. The Si-nal countdown has hit zero and our very last episode is upon us. Join Jane, Alex and Duncan for a feature length nostalgia extravaganza and revisit the greatest hits of The Real Pod over the last eight years. Hear clips from our very first episode, cursed footage from some very late nights, and a very special clip from a very special guest. In the words of the Max Key corner sting, we'll never forget you.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: My Kitchen Rules NZ: Week 5
items.content:encoded:
It's the final week of both My Kitchen Rules NZ and The Real Pod and we are feeling wobblier than Matt and Kurt's panna cotta. Join us as we recap the weirdest comedian dining experience ever captured on camera, and the dramatic finale that saw the best (men) chefs in the country help to decide the $100K winner. Also: Duncan fell asleep in public again and Alex embarrassed herself in front of a reality star again. The Real Pod!

items.title: Remember When: Sky 1 used to show soft porn
items.content:encoded:
Did you ever stay up extra late, one hand hovering nervously over the remote, waiting to catch a tantalising glimpse of nudity on TV? You were not alone. Join us for the final episode of Remember When as we reminisce about the good ol' days of the 90s. When Sky 1's raunchy after-midnight programming, captured the attention of likeminded viewers across the nation.

items.title: My Kitchen Rules NZ: Week 4
items.content:encoded:
The stars are out to play this week and we aren’t just talking about Mike Pero at the Christchurch show. Celebrities descended on MKRNZ to judge a six course degustation, which resulted in some of the horniest feedback this podcast has ever heard. There’s also a lot of new radio shows being announced, yet still no invite for Big Mum, Lexie and Dunc? Weird.

items.title: Remember When: We all lost our minds over chocolate milk
items.content:encoded:
What happens when you mix fancy artisan milk with yummy chocolate? Lines round the block, security guards in supermarkets, and Chelsea Winter stepping over her own aunty of course! Join us as we remember the release Lewis Road Creamery chocolate milk in 2014, a product which instantly created a black market, national chaos, and global attention.

items.title: Remember When: Bill English’s spaghetti pizza broke the internet
items.content:encoded:
Who the hell puts tinned spaghetti on pizza?! In April 2017 that cry was heard the world over after then prime minister Bill English casually posted his spag-covered pizza on Facebook and asked the internet to ‘like if you agree’. Was it a clever distraction tactic at a time the PM was under intense scrutiny, or an innocent play at connecting with the voting youth? Only Bill knows why he shared his controversial pizza piccie, but we’ll all remember it forever.


Join the Real Pod community!

Jane, Duncan and Alex are joined in the studio by the freshly crowned winner of Celebrity Treasure Island 2023 to talk about the highs and lows, the secret alliances and the beauty of sleeping in the finalist yurt.

items.title: Remember When: Thin Lizzy 6-in-1 promised a makeup miracle
items.content:encoded:
In 2005, one groundbreaking makeup product emerged that promised to fix every one of our problems in one sunkissed swipe. She was a bronzer, a blusher, a contour, a foundation, an eyeshadow and a lipstick, and she came with an iconic jingle that basically defined what it meant to be a woman ("mobile, hairstyle, lingerie, PDA"). Join Jane Yee and Alex Casey as they remember the glowing heyday of Thin Lizzy 6-in-1.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Celebrity Treasure Island: Week 5
items.content:encoded:
The collapse of the comedian coalition has sent shockwaves through camp in the penultimate week of our favourite silly little game. We started the week waving farewell to Big Bopper Steve Price, and ended it with Laura sending Eli back to the flat after defeating her bestie in a game of topply card sand baggie balance. Now just five castaways remain while we perch precariously on the edge of our seats to see if one of the comedians can conquer, or if the treasure be unearthed by powerhouses Turia or Nick.

items.title: Remember When: C4 blasted onto our screens
items.content:encoded:
In 2003 we were paying $30 for CDs and mainlining music videos. The internet was a bit slow, so there was huge demand for music videos on the telly to see the not many, if any, dudes who could roll like this. Juice TV had been plugging away on Sky, but then C4 entered the chat offering endless music videos that were free for all, and a slew of top notch hosting talent to boot. As C4 celebrates its 20 year anniversary, Jane and Duncan remember the glorious arrival of our last great music channel while simultaneously realising we didn’t know how good we had it.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Celebrity Treasure Island: Week 4
items.content:encoded:
Water levels rose at the lake this week as the tears flowed and the eliminated rode (off into the sunset forever, RIP). The individual game is here and it's brought out a ruthlessness in our castaways that we never saw coming. And the biggest shock of all? Not even aliens could protect Blair from topply blocks in the elimination arena.

items.title: Remember When: Abstain for the Game was the century’s most bizarre ad campaign
items.content:encoded:
Ahead of the incredibly tense 2011 Rugby World Cup, Abstain for the Game was a Telecom (now Spark) ad campagin using former All Black captain Sean Fitzpatrick, in a tuxedo, driving a pink dodgem, asking a tightly wound nation to keep it in their pants. It was an extremely odd ad, and created a furious response from a humourless public. Within days it was withdrawn with heavy apologies. But the ad has aged well, and as The Real Pod remembers when, they also ask – did we get this one wrong?

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Celebrity Treasure Island: Week 3
items.content:encoded:
The dictator, James Mustapic, joins us this week to recap the week that was on Celebrity Treasure Island: Te Waipounamu. A week that saw comedians causing chaos, teams being cleft in twain and two powerhouse players heading for home. It’s already been an iconic season, but we’ll never forget the moment that guy from Shorty Street Uno-reversed Eli’s mercy card with the kind of sensational block Mark Richardson could only dream of.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Remember When: The Ferndale Strangler terrorised Shortland Street
items.content:encoded:
At 7 o'clock in December of 2007, after a six-month-long mystery, families gathered around their television sets to discover the identity of the serial killer responsible for murdering several female Shortland Street characters. What ensued was one of New Zealand television's most iconic moments. Join us as we remember the Ferndale Strangler, Joey Henderson.

items.title: Celebrity Treasure Island: Week 2
items.content:encoded:
It wasn’t a good week in Te Waipounamu for anyone whose name begins with M. After losing captaincy to James, Matilda beheaded Mary (with a little help from slippery Jordan) before succumbing to the guillotine herself at the hands of one Sir Blair Grylls. Our beloved Tāme bowed out on account of his lovely old bones, leaving a gaping hole in the spirit of Tohorā and, quite frankly, the whole nation. It seems the early game niceties have come to an end as alliances form, trust is broken and a certain someone doesn’t share his cheeseburger. Last week we had a lovely telly show, but this week we have a game.

items.title: Remember When: Tellydots took over our TVs
items.content:encoded:
In October 2000 TV3, in partnership with BP, Pizza Hut and KFC, brought the global marketing phenomenon of Tellydots to our shores. Captivated by the promise of prizes such as Holden Barinas, portable CD players, and even $333,333.33 in cash, we had nothing better to do than stick a small piece of plastic to our television sets. Join us as we remember the Y2K Tellydot promotion.


If you enjoy this podcast and are hungry for more, sign up for The Real Pod Extra on Substack. There’s plenty of free pop culture content there and if you upgrade to a paid subscription you’ll get a bonus episodes of The Real Pod every week (featuring reality TV recaps and pop culture gossip) along with other exclusive perks.

items.title: Bonus - Remember When: the worm ruled an election (Gone by Lunchtime x The Real Pod)
items.content:encoded:
In an act of utter madness, Gone By Lunchtime (long term rival of The Real Pod) did a 12 hour livestream last week featuring a list of high profile MPs, political commentators and… Duncan and Jane. Taken from the eleventh hour of the Election 2023 Megapod, join us for the chaotic crossover episode nobody asked for. We discuss the intersection of politics and reality TV (read: Dancing with The Stars) and collectively Remember When the worm ruled our televised election debates.


If you enjoy this podcast and are hungry for more, sign up for The Real Pod Extra on Substack. items.title: Celebrity Treasure Island: Week 1
items.content:encoded:
As Alex heads off to eat, pray, love, 18 celebrities land on a lake to starve, cry, vomit. That’s right, Celebrity Treasure Island is back baby, and we couldn’t be more excited. Week one didn’t disappoint as our castaways looked for a loo, brokered alliances and battled the windiest wind that ever did wind. The beans are soaking, the comedians are joking, and Steve Price is Bloking. Thank God for this show.

items.title: In which we drop a massive bombshell...
items.content:encoded:
Before we get to our massive bombshell, there's some thrilling celebrity news to get through including Jojo Siwa's southern sojourn, Kourtney Kardashian's pregnancy and Erin Simpson's chook-hungry baby. Also, Jane had a handsome bum doctor, and Alex had a scandal queenie at Cirque on Ice. We also recap the latest on Love Island UK before dropping some very big news about the future of the pod. Whatever could it be? You'll have to listen to find out.

items.title: What to make of Love Island week one?
items.content:encoded:
The juggernaut reality series is back on TVNZ+ and has switched up the format a bit. Girls AND boys mingling at the start? Levitating contestants? Turkey teeth? Jane and Alex dissect their first impressions of the show and the cast, and Duncan ponders a new set of gnashers on his upcoming trip to continental Europe. Also, there's another Bachelor baby on the way, Shortland Street is about to drop a massive three-night cliffhanger, and Below Deck Down Under is coming back!

items.title: Did you see Mike Puru's media-themed musical number?
items.content:encoded:
Allow us to take you inside the glitz and glamour of the Voyager Media Awards, in which MC Mike Puru delivered an incredible media-themed musical number to a standing ovation (from Alex Casey and Duncan Greive). We recap all the gossip and celebrity sightings of the week, and Jane Yee botches a hang with Dame Susan Devoy. All that, plus the bleak return of the Kardashians, a promising Taskmaster cast and a look back at Treasure Island, which premiered 26 years ago this week (we thought it was 25 but alas we cannot count).

items.title: A chaos pod of the highest order
items.content:encoded:
The trio are finally reunited in the same studio for a true chaos pod. In the Real News, the Cornies have come through with beautiful IRL interactions and beautiful gifts, there’s been a dearth of celebrity sightings for Jane and an embarrassment of riches for Alex and Duncan. Here’s a reality check: Paris Hilton’s chihuahua is dead at 23, Honey Boo Boo has finished high school and Sophia Grace has had a baby. Also: we look at the new season of Selling Sunset, Three’s new reality show Tracked and Mike Puru’s incredible selling show on the NZ Herald.

items.title: The King's coronation and a very special interview...
items.content:encoded:
In the biggest reality television event of the year (apart from the Married at First Sight reunion), King Charles finally took the throne over the weekend and it could not have been weirder experience to recap. Then, we are joined in the studio by a very special guest from television history who recounts his unbelievably shocking experience being apart of a New Zealand reality show in the mid-2000s.

items.title: Bonus pod: How good was Dei Hamo's 'We Gon' Ride'?!
items.content:encoded:
In this extra special episode of The Real Pod, Jane Yee, Alex Casey and Duncan Greive don our silkiest tracksuits and go all the way back to spring 2004, when Dei Hamo's 'We Gon' Ride' exploded onto the New Zealand airwaves. As you can read about now in The Spinoff's oral history of the song, this was a time when hip hop in Aotearoa was at its peak, music video directors were hot property, and kids were still buying CD singles. So how did Sani Sagala, a former musician working in a South Auckland bakery, find himself in the centre of the hip hop storm with the highest selling single of the year? You'll have to listen (or read the story) to find out.

You can read the full oral history of 'We Gon Ride' here.

items.title: What's Suzanne Paul got to do with the Coronation?
items.content:encoded:
Pour yourself a cuppa in your favourite novelty mug, because Jane Yee, Alex Casey and Duncan Greive are back for another week of pop culture gossip. We investigate why Suzanne Paul is promoting everything from Liquorland to Burger King in the lead-up to the King's Coronation this weekend, and which Pussycat Doll is performing at the Coronation concert. Also, the teams for Tracked have been announced, Jason Momoa is mainlining Mainland cheese and Jane is still battling a flea problem.

items.title: Will The Traitors NZ be the spiciest reality show of the year?
items.content:encoded:
Back by popular demand (a single one star review) Alex Casey, Duncan Greive and Jane Yee are back with more local popular culture and reality TV gossip. Harry Warner is coming back to Ferndale with a new face, the Briscoes Lady isn't going anywhere and Paul Henry is coming back to host The Traitors, the most anticipated reality show of all year. All that, plus encounters with fleas, wizards and former Married at First Sight contestants blowing up our phones.

items.title: Is Suzanne Paul replacing the Briscoes lady?
items.content:encoded:
The gang is back together for more weird news and reality gossip than you can shake an amulet at. Duncan Greive is back from an ancient wonder of the world, Jane Yee is incensed by an upcoming feijoa festival and Alex Casey clocked a couple of exciting local celebs on a weekend getaway. Neil Finn is on Bluey, The Phantom of the Opera is no more and Suzanne Paul has arrived in the Briscoes universe. Plus, we look at what the cast of MAFSAU are doing with their newfound fame and fortune.

items.title: Succession spoilers and Taylor Swift's break-up
items.content:encoded:
Married at First Sight has finished for another year, but that doesn't mean your old pals at The Real Pod are going anywhere. Join Jane Yee and Alex Casey as the recap their pop culture consumption over Easter, deep-dive into Rod Stewart's lack of dock rocking and recap what we know about Taylor Swift's break-up. Also, Succession just delivered one of the best episodes in yonks, Jane is making a bid for Celebrity Bake Off and Max Key is trying to launch a new and confusing catch phrase.

items.title: MAFS AU recap week nine: It all ends with sexting in a nightclub
items.content:encoded:
We have reached the end of our journey and what an emotional roller coaster it has been. Jane Yee and Alex Casey are here to recap the final vows and reunion special of Married at First Sight Australia, complete with unwanted print-outs, sexting scandals and a glimmer (or at least a work trip) on the horizon for Jesse and Claire. Which bride has Duncan been spotted with around town? Why is Cam getting naked in a nightclub? And what happened to Tahnee and Ollie's fish? Plus a quick visit to the Max Key Corner for the first time in yonks.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: MAFS AU recap week four: A new monster is revealed
items.content:encoded:
The secret is out: Adam and Claire kissed on that big night out and everyone is fuming! Join Jane Yee, Alex Casey and Duncan Greive as we recap all the drama from yet another outstanding week on Married At First Sight Australia, including the arrival of two new ridiculous couples and the exorcism of two of the most toxic. Plus, we dissect the complete undoing of Adam, the bizarre Harrison redemption arc and the unbridled fury of Alyssa. What MAFS monster will arise next week? We're scared.

items.title: Treasure Island: Fans v Faves recap, week five
items.content:encoded:
We've made it to the final week of Treasure Island: Fans v Faves! Game titans Art Green and Lance Savali have been knocked out in an epic fire-making task, last-fan-standing Wardie couldn't last on the endurance pole and we have an incredible top three – Dame Susan Devoy, Matty McLean and Lana Searle. Who will find the treasure and be our VIP guest on the pod tomorrow? And what surprise has Jane hidden in our studio? You'll have to listen to find out...

items.title: MAFS AU recap week three: A very revealing intimacy week
items.content:encoded:
A week of longing gazes, melty hugs and intimate dates sees some couples thrive and others completely fall apart. Alyssa and Duncan step into their Barbie and Ken potency, Jesse and Claire turn a corner and even Melinda and Layton are getting along. As for Shannon and Harrison... are they the worst grooms the franchise has ever seen? What will happen to Caitlin and Bronte? And will any allegations ever stick to the self-proclaimed Tefal man?

items.title: Treasure Island: Fans v Faves recap, week four
items.content:encoded:
This week the island becomes a true chess match for the faves (at times literally). Dame Susan is having a medical emergency, Matty McLean is dumping all of his emotions and Joe Cotton is working on her most dramatic winged eyeliner yet. Plus, which celeb pretends to have a serious bout of diarrhoea to secure their future in the game? You’ll have to listen to find out.

items.title: Treasure Island: Fans v Faves recap, week three
items.content:encoded:
This week, the teams merge and tensions arise. How will the celebrities cope with having boring old normies around? Will old alliances hold up? And how is anyone else ever going to beat Art and Lance at this game? Also, Jane gives us the inside scoop on two of the most jaw-dropping elimination battles that Treasure Island has ever seen. Bring tissues and build your own barbeques, bitches!

items.title: MAFS AU recap week one: a Girl on the Outside?
items.content:encoded:
We're recapping the 10th season of Married at First Sight Australia and there could not be more drama! Week one saw the return of the "Girl on the Outside", a handful of contenders in the running for 'Worst Man Ever' and more beauty influencers than you can shake a ring light at. Who's teeth has Jane the most excited? Are Grain Waves chips or a crackers? And which couples are actually going to last this twisted experiment? You'll have to listen to find out.

Week one saw the return of the "Girl on the Outside", a handful of contenders in the running for 'Worst Man Ever' and more beauty influencers than you can shake a ring light at. Who's teeth has Jane the most excited? Are Grain Waves chips or a crackers? And which couples are actually going to last this twisted experiment? You'll have to listen to find out.

Join the Real Pod community!
Go here for The Real Pod Corner on Facebook
And here to chat on our Discord server

You'll have to listen to find out.

items.title: The Spinoff presents SUPERPOD 2022
items.content:encoded:
SUPERPOD is back! And for 2022, we're bigger than ever! Hosted by Gone By Lunchtime's Toby Manhire and featuring Jane Yee and Alex Casey from The Real Pod, Duncan Grieve from The Fold, Leonie Holden from Nē?, Simon Pound from Business Is Boring, The Spinoff editor Madeline Chapman and The Spinoff Podcast Network's Te Aihe Butler, SUPERPOD 2022 might as well be the Avengers: Endgame of SUPERPODs. From the Black Ferns historic win to Mike King's villainous turn on Celebrity Treasure Island we cover the incredible highs and lows of what has been a terribly special year.

itunes.subtitle: Alex, Jane and Duncan discuss the craziest Real News of the year.
itunes.summary:
It's been a hell of year for a number of reasons, and that's even before Rita Ora arrived with her tiny cigarettes and her big ideas. In this episode, we look at back at the best bits of real news that have come across our Real Pod news-desk in 2022 including a mystery ham, the birth of Baby Zerin and the welcome return of Max Key to public life.

items.title: The most memorable MAFS AU contestants of all time
items.content:encoded:
As we reflect on the year of 2022 and the many years that have come before it, we thought it was the perfect time to look back at the 20 most memorable MAFS AU characters (from mostly the last four seasons). Join us as we reminisce about Pasta a la Troy, "I'm not your therapist" and Jessika Power's vocal fry. All that, plus an exclusive acceptance speech beamed in from across the ditch that has to be heard to be believed.

items.title: Our favourite international reality shows of 2022
items.content:encoded:
There's no local reality TV to talk about so we are taking a look back at the most memorable international shows of the year. Jane dials in from isolation to recap her beloved Sister Wives and The Bachelorette US, and then Alex and Duncan count down 10 of the best offerings from around the world. From Love Island UK to Hunted Australia to Selling Sunset, it has been a bumper year – but which show will take out the coveted top spot of these hastily thrown-together awards? You'll have to listen to find out!

items.title: Celebrity Treasure Island Week 7 and the band is back together

Everyone is back from school holidays and boy oh boy do we have a show for you. Duncan is wearing a gold chain, Alex is pole dancing and Jane is hobnobbing with Ron Cribb at the bowling. items.title: Celebrity Treasure Island Week 5 and The Block NZ Week 12
items.content:encoded:
The monolith is opened and the Blue Penguin is unmasked in a huge week of reveals in Aotearoa. What does this huge twist in the game mean for Celebrity Treasure Island NZ? How is Te Kohe Tuhaka such a challenge beast? And how much filthier is Dame Susan Devoy going to get? All that, plus the return of flappy shoe, a late night car fire and the penultimate week on The Block NZ. Get into it.

How is Te Kohe Tuhaka such a challenge beast? And how much filthier is Dame Susan Devoy going to get? All that, plus the return of flappy shoe, a late night car fire and the penultimate week on The Block NZ. Get into it.

items.title: Celebrity Treasure Island Week 4 and The Block NZ Week 11
items.content:encoded:
You won’t believe the number of celebrities we have seen IRL this week. Duncan saw Taika Waititi and Elizabeth Banks at the rugby and Alex saw The Mole at The Mall. There’s a fresh crop of lads for us to analyse ahead of the launch of FBOY Island NZ and a mysterious monolith on Celebrity Treasure Island that may or may not contain a naked and afraid Casey Franks. All that, plus The Block NZ groans towards the finish line with cat litter driveways and overstuffed outdoor areas. What’s the deal with old people and singing? You’ll have to listen to find out.

items.title: Celebrity Treasure Island Week 3 and The Block NZ Week 10
items.content:encoded:
Celebrity Treasure Island is rocked with another bombshell as Mike King does the most emotional dump of all time. Dame Susan and Lynette are at loggerheads over an apple, Siobhan has more alliances than hot dinners and Dylan is finally reunited with a tramp. We've also got the latest on The Masked Singer, FBoy Island NZ and all the hot goss from Stairwell Week on The Block NZ (hold your applause).

items.title: Celebrity Treasure Island Week 2 and The Block NZ Week 9
items.content:encoded:
Everyone’s talking about the new King but we only want to talk about Mike King. The bombshell intruder finally arrived on Celebrity Treasure Island this week and waged a path of destruction that ended with a truly shocking elimination that nobody could have seen coming. Meanwhile on The Block NZ, our teams repainted a wall. Also: you won’t believe which A-lister celebrity was (lost and) found at the Billie Eilish concert last week.

items.content:encoded:

As the crew wraps up their last charter, Benny reflects on his growth, Jamie has a tantrum and Aesha says “cooch” a lot. Plus, which two crew members finally hook up? The answer WILL shock you.

items.title: Celebrity Treasure Island Week 1 and The Block NZ Week 8
items.content:encoded:
So much reality TV, so little time. We are fizzing for the return of Celebrity Treasure Island, and the first week did not disappoint. From handsy challenges to uncomfortable rapping to whatever Lynette Forday is up to, we are already obsessed. Things are not quite as thrilling over on The Block NZ for kitchen week, but at least we get to see one contestant's voice box on national television. Also: Big Worm.

items.title: Below Deck Down Under Recap: Episode 16, Culver loses his bearings ⚓
items.content:encoded:
It is the penultimate episode of Below Deck Down Under and they saved the best till last. Culver has gone off piste and is pashing guests, Brittini is wearing her heart on her sleeve and Jamie has started steaming Benny's shirts for some reason. Plus, are these the messiest guests in Below Deck history? And will they make it off the beach before low tide?

On board Thalassa, Jason has gone on a rampage and fired everyone, Ryan is mooning himself silly and another New Zealander joins the crew. But did Captain Jason go to Burning Man or Coachella? All this and so, so, so much more.

items.title: The Block NZ Recap: Week 4, the mo must go
items.content:encoded:
We've got a lot of real news to get through this week including watching Love Island at the pub, all the Celebrity Treasure Island cast announcements and the return of Heartbreak Island. But the big scandal of the week is the fact Ben on The Block broke his moustache-shaving promise, and therefore our hearts. Would you rather sandpaper off your teeth, shoot your toes with a nail gun, or listen to this cool podcast episode? The decision is easy.

items.title: Below Deck Down Under Recap: Episode 12, Nautical but nice ⚓
items.content:encoded:
Once again, we have come up with a better episode title than Below Deck Down Under itself. It is Christmas on Thalassa this week, complete with Magda's tampon snow, Aesha's kinky reindeer and Culver in the role of jolly Saint Nick. But will Benny experience a Christmas miracle and be able to keep his job on deck? We consult the oracle (Duncan) to see what is in store for our friends at sea.

But how does one distinguish between an eating squid and a swimming squid? All that, plus some anthropological analysis on the role of smoking in the Below Deck multiverse.
Join The Real Pod community!
Go here to join The Real Pod Corner on Facebook
And here to chat telly on our Discord server

items.title: The Block NZ Recap: Week 1, stuck in the mud 🏡
items.content:encoded:
Hello, is this knobs and knockers? Four teams have returned for a redemption season of The Block NZ, and we are celebrating with what might be our worst episode yet. Jane forgets to record for a bit, Duncan is grizzly about the cast and Alex is trying to keep schtum.

items.title: Below Deck Down Under Recap: Episode 9, a skeleton crew ⚓
items.content:encoded:
If you thought it was going to be smooth sailing this week, we regret to inform you that one of the crew has been struck down with the novel coronavirus and another is on holiday. We have no choice but to channel what we have learned from the Below Deck Down Under crew, including the enthusiasm of Chef Ryan at dinner time, the unwelcomeness of Keith Stone at a stag do and the endless waffle of Magda on the phone with Erik.


Join The Real Pod community!

Go here to join The Real Pod Corner on Facebook

And here to chat telly on our Discord server

items.title: Below Deck Down Under Recap: Episode 8, a mutiny on the pod ⚓
items.content:encoded:
Just like a big barf in a jacuzzi, things have gone truly awry this week. Jane has been on her deathbed, Duncan has orchestrated a mutiny and Alex is still recovering from an oyster she ate 10 years ago. What better time to prepare yourself a huge bowl of flavourless risotto and dive into the latest drama of Below Deck Down Under.

items.title: Below Deck Down Under Recap: Episode 7, the wet vac returns ⚓
items.content:encoded:
It's a week of horrific leaks, from Jane's roof caving in to Benny's toilet overflowing once more. Join as we recap the latest from a soggy Thalassa, including Culver's new mullet-wearing plumber character, Jamie ripping his swim shirt off to swim and a trip to the whitest beach in the Whitsundsays.

items.title: Below Deck Down Under Recap: Episode 6, the ghost of Marilyn ⚓
items.content:encoded:
Go an fetch your finest mullet wig, because Culver the Entertainment officer has found a new apprentice in Magda. Meanwhile, Aesha is microwaving the milk, Ryan is serving seafood to all the guests who hate seafood, and Benny is having yet another sooky la-la. If you like Love Island, we also somehow end up talking about that quite a bit? It is what it is on Below Deck Down Under.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Below Deck Down Under Recap: Episode 5, the King of Monaco ⚓
items.content:encoded:
This week on Below Deck Down Under, the primary guest climbs aboard with nothing but a tiny robe and some huge ideas about interior decorating. Also Cheffy is cheffing harder than he has ever cheffed, Magda doesn't know what a garnish is and Captain Jason takes his shirt off. Join Jane, Alex and Duncan as they recap the week that was, but don't you dare step over that anchor chain or we'll make you wear the idiot helmet.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:encoded:

items.title: Below Deck Down Under Recap: Episode 3, with primary guest Aesha Scott ⚓
items.content:encoded:
All crew on deck! A very special primary is onboard - NZ’s own chief stew Aesha Scott joins Duncan and Jane for a chinwag about life, love and loathing as the breakout star of the Below Deck franchise. Of course there’s also a recap of episode three, in which rock and roll hits the high seas, Jamie throws a tantrum about the lack of single ladies and Ryan is… well, Ryan’s Ryan.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: DWTS NZ Recap: Week six, a winner is crowned 💃🏽
items.content:encoded:
Despite the best efforts of Covid-19, Dancing With the Stars persisted all the way to the grand finale. Jazz Thornton was crowned the winner, Clinton Randall did a dance with Nadia Lim to 'My Sharona', and Kerre Woodham danced with a paddle instead of a partner. Also: Jane does a RAT live on pod and Alex recounts a harrowing interview experience with Tina Cross.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: DWTS NZ Recap: Week four, our head judge is away 💃🏽
items.content:encoded:
Evacuate the dance floor, our head judge Jane is away this week and we are sorry (so sorry). Join Alex, Duncan and Te Aihe as we struggle through to the end of the show worse than Eric Murray trying to find “the eight” on ‘Another One Bites the Dust’. It’s club bangers and “my jams” week on DWTS, so which of our jams would we bring to the show? And which star had the very best jam of all? And why do all the clothes look like they are going to dissolve in water? All that, and a bunch of other unmissable guff about fedoras.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.content:encoded:
We're back for another season of Dancing With the Stars - complete with two new judges, a sparkly new set, and a shocker first elimination. Head Real Pod judge Jane makes some big calls based on very little evidence, Judge Alex thinks everyone should win, and Judge Duncan is furiously noshing on mandarin skin...but why? Join us to find out!

items.title: Real Recap: MAFS AU, week ten 💍
items.content:encoded:
Charge your shoey and join Alex, Jane and Duncan as they toast the end of another season of Married at First Sight Australia. While dinner is served to the participants one last time, we discover that Ella and Mitch have rekindled their relationship, just as Dom and Jack have called it quits. The following night, the gang gather on the couches to watch some incriminating footage and learn that Cody is still yuck after all. It’s the best worst telly there is, and what a ride it’s been. Stay tuned to The Real Pod, our next Real Recap will be the super delayed new season of Dancing With Stars NZ!

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Real Recap: MAFS AU, week nine 💍
items.content:encoded:
We’ve finally reached the business end of Married at First Sight Australia as our participants come face to face for final vows. Ahead of the big decision, Cody breaks his mother-in-law’s trust (and teacup), Mitch and Ella fall apart at the seams, and Jack is collateral damage in Liv’s vendetta against Dom. Join the unholy throuple of Alex, Jane, and Duncan as they say “I do” to the penultimate week of love loathing.



Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Real Recap: MAFS AU, week eight 💍
items.content:encoded:
With final vows fast approaching, Reflections Week saw the Married at First Sight Australia participants thinking ahead to life on the outside. Hard questions were asked on final dates and unwanted guests caused a stir at the girls’ and boys’ nights. We raised a shoey to farewell Al and Sam, and raised our eyebrows at Selin’s demands for drama. Join Alex, Duncan and Jane for an extremely scientific analysis of this extremely scientific experiment.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Noodles? We’ll show you noodles
items.content:encoded:
This week on The Real Pod we're dreaming of a better world; a world of retro papercuts, plentiful chicken noodles and Toyota Corollas from 1993. Alex and Jane recap all the important news of the week, including the launch of the Real Love Boat and a shirtless Zoom snafu for the ages. What’s the difference between a raisin and a sultana? What is the best prickle to get? All that, and a bombshell about The Real Pod format that will rock the experiment.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Real Recap: MAFS AU, week seven 💍
items.content:encoded:
Forget dinner; nothing but drama was served on Married at First Sight Australia this week, and not a single one of us was left hungry. We said goodbye to the last of our new couples as Carolina and Danny turned the commitment ceremony on its head before being turfed from the experiment. Liv continued her crusade to become the most villainous MAFS participant since time began. The revelation of an OnlyFans account sent shockwaves through the group, which led to the crowning of our new king and queen: Jack and Dom. Join Alex, Jane and Duncan as they rake through the coals of Homestay Week.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Honours notebook
items.content:encoded:
First things first, does gum REALLY sit in your stomach for years and years?? The trio turn news-reading into mythbusting, raising the important q’s. As well as important q’s, Duncan reveals he’s a notebook hoarder and wants to giveaway archive Spinoff secrets, Alex relays her trip to the rattery, and (breaking news) the queen sorta looks like a watery stain.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Potato imposter
items.content:encoded:
Some serious breaking news: Dug the Potato is not who he says he is. A shell-shocked Alex and Jane process the news that Dug is, in fact, a gourd, before exploring the other big news of the week. Dancing With the Stars is coming back (again), cardboard cutout sales are going ballistic and a crafty scammer is stuffing tobacco pouches with mouldy bread.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Real Recap: MAFS AU, week five 💍
items.content:encoded:
It’s off to the movies as the families beam in for Feedback Week on Married at First Sight Australia. Al flexes his gaming skills to his father in law, Nona’s about to learn Domenica has period sex and Brent’s dad isn’t a fan of his new daughter-in-law’s filthy mouth. Meanwhile, Matt is hoping some perfume will spark joy in ice-cold Kate and Carolina definitely does not want to go to Bondi.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Real Recap: MAFS AU, week four 💍
items.content:encoded:
As the death knell tolls for Andrew and Holly's relationship, wedding bells are ringing for three new couples joining the experiment. We meet Kate, who has only ever wanted to be loved, just not by her new husband Matt. Carolina, whose make up meltdown delayed her nuptials to Dion by three hours. And Daniel, whose doomed marriage to Jessica already has him eyeing up Carolina. Turn up the air con – things are about to get hot.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: RAT race
items.content:encoded:
Taika Waititi got a tattoo of Jane, a bull floated 80km down a river and we are really working our anxiety night shifts at the moment. In other news, Jane has had not one but two police interactions this week, Alex is starting a national conversation about "bumples" and Duncan is buying a chainsaw. It's fine, everything's fine.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Up hill and down dale
items.content:encoded:
The Queen has Covid, a Finnish skier has a frozen penis and a Kiwi has been promoted to Chief Stew on the upcoming season of Below Deck: Down Under. If you thought that was all the important news you could handle, we’ve also got an update on Jane’s cleaning project, a review of the Covid-19 spit test and a Coke-based revelation that will shock and divide the nation.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Real Recap: MAFS AU, week two 💍
items.content:encoded:
Take two weddings, one dinner party, three gross looking cupcakes, approximately 350 sexual partners and the dregs of a dinner party shoey. Mix them all together, bake for four nights and voila! You’ve got week two on Married at First Sight Australia. Join Alex, Jane and Duncan as they recap the best, worst and most problematic moments of confession week.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Eggcorn salad
items.content:encoded:
Like three yolks crammed into an egg, the trio are back for the another week of unusual news and real life humiliations. What would your 60 second talent be? How cool is it to draw eyes on a piece of art? And do monkeys really need Marvin Gaye to 'get it on'? All that, and one pod member admits they've been involved in a long Irish con.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod is taking a short break over summer. We'll be back with new episodes soon, but until then here's one of our favourites from 2021.

items.title: Summer reissue: Gossip with Colin Mathura-Jeffree
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod is taking a short break over summer. We'll be back with new episodes soon, but until then here's one of our favourites from 2021.

In June, patron saint of The Real Pod Colin Mathura-Jeffree joined us in the studio for a very special episode celebrating Gossip Week on The Spinoff. Colin told us some of the wildest gossip he’s heard about himself, explained why influencers will never be true celebrities and regaled us with stories from the red carpet.

items.title: The Spinoff presents SUPERPOD 2021
items.content:encoded:
Hosted by Gone By Lunchtime’s Toby Manhire and featuring representatives from The Real Pod, The Fold, Nē? and Dietary Requirements, SUPERPOD 2021 is the crossover podcast event we’ve been waiting all year for. Join us as we relive the highs and lows and heroes and villains of the longest, shortest year in living memory.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: All the reality TV we watched in 2021
items.content:encoded:
For the final episode of 2021, Jane and Duncan try to remember all the reality TV they’ve talked about on The Real Pod this year. From Sam and Gonzo going at it across the MAFS AU dinner table all the way to Alby’s matcha-fuelled GKBO win, including Popstars, The Bachelor/ette, The Apprentice Aotearoa, Drag Race Down Under, The Block and Celebrity Treasure Island – what moments have lingered in the memory?

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Briscoes Lady envy
items.content:encoded:
Would you rather get snowed in at a Danish Ikea or a British pub with an Oasis cover band? Does the Briscoes Lady have the perfect work-life balance? And what happened when Jane tried to do a Great Kiwi Bake Off technical challenge at home? All this and more with Jane and Duncan on your home of real news, real life and really good times.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Big ups
items.content:encoded:
Duncan and Jane dip their toes in TVNZ’s show lineup for 2022, try to figure out how the government’s Covid policy applies to sex with strangers and offer some style advice for all that extra lockdown hair you’ve been growing. There’s also crypto chat, a new caking-meets-sports show and some as-it-happens literal breaking news.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Block party for Tim and Arty
items.content:encoded:
Join Jane and Duncan as they celebrate an almost win at the NZ Podcast Awards, debrief on The Block NZ auctions and reveal what their very first in-store purchases were at level three, step two. Plus there’s a terrorist possum on the loose in Dunedin, a duck has run a marathon in New York and Taylor Swift has her fans seeing red.





Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Bonus chat: What’s going on at Three?
items.content:encoded:
In a very special The Fold / The Real Pod crossover episode, Jane and Duncan delve into the first ever Discovery upfronts, in which Three’s new owner just announced a bunch of new shows, two new channels and a very reality TV-heavy new direction.

items.title: Never judge a hand sanitiser by its bottle
items.content:encoded:
Camilla Parker Bowles won’t stop talking about Joe Biden’s "long fart", it’s raining cats and logs in Windsor, lady condors are birthing chicks without gentleman condors and a journalist reckons you can cook a steak in a dishwasher. Join Duncan and Jane as they discuss all these stories, along with a tale of mistaken hand sanitiser identity that will have you looking twice before your next squirt.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: McDonald’s Young Entertainers mosh pit
items.content:encoded:
Jane (cross-legged on the floor) is joined by guest host Chris Parker (lying on bed) to trawl through the week’s Real News and everything else. We’ve got tiny villages of vegetables and spoons popping up on Auckland berms, The Wiggles are playing R18 bar gigs now, there's peacocks on the loose in Johnsonville and more.

Vote for The Real Pod in the NZ Podcast Awards! Visit nzpodcastawards.com to vote.

items.title: Real Recap: Celebrity Treasure Island, week two 🏝
items.content:encoded:
Week two on Treasure Island sees our celebs hungry, tired and jonesing for the win. Honu find themselves in the middle of an alliance tug-of-war, Katipo’s desperation for some kai reaches fever pitch, and a forced leadership change rattles the usually unflappable team Repo. Deals are been brokered, toes are being broken, fish are being caught and dances are being taught. Join Duncan and Jane as they get into the seaweeds of this ridiculously watchable wee telly show.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: A bloody fool and a big wash
items.content:encoded:
Big reveals on The Real Pod this week as Duncan and Jane go under the Real News sheets to find all sorts of alarming matter. Which celebrity is 'gramming their Covid journey from MIQ? Why has an unearthed recording of a duck from 1987 hit the headlines? And where the hell is Alex Casey? In Real Life Jane enjoys a significant Big Wash and Duncan's wife drops a filthy bombshell that leaves hime reeling. Plus we chat Real Bits – the most interesting moments of the week on our screens.

items.title: Extreme Makeover: Podcast Edition
items.content:encoded:
A whole episode of real news, real life, real bits and real reviews? Welcome to the new Real Pod! We’ve got phallic veg, an Apprentice Aotearoa bombshell, googly eyes spotted in the wild, a tiny little bit of The Block NZ... it’s just the same old Real Pod with new stings. Stay tuned for the first Real Recap episode after Celebrity Treasure Island on Wednesday night 🏝️

items.title: Send in the clown
items.content:encoded:
In another lockdown bonus edition of The Real Pod, Alex and Jane beam in from their bedrooms to discuss the extended Celebrity Treasure Island trailer, the dangers of IRL grocery shopping and Alex’s big 30th birthday plans (spoiler alert: she’s going to have a shower). Plus the economy of Little Shops, a round up of Love Island UK and an announcement about changes to your favourite silly podcast. 

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: Double thumbs up for a level four pod
items.content:encoded:
As we traverse into another leg of lockdown Alex, Jane and Duncan contemplate what the animals are up to while the humans are hunkering down, weep at the postponement of the Celebrity Treasure Island launch party and unanimously decide on the funniest food. Meanwhile, on The Block NZ, it’s garage and laundry week featuring a very naked Tim and a very luxe sauna just for clothes.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: The Fold: Meet the man behind some of NZ's best reality TV
items.content:encoded:
If you're a regular listener of The Real Pod you might know Duncan has another podcast, The Fold, where he gets in-depth and nerdy about the NZ media landscape. The latest episode is a bit of a Real Pod crossover, so we wanted to share it here so you don't miss out! It's a chat with Jon Wild, series producer and director of some of our favourite reality series of all time, including The Apprentice Aotearoa, The Bachelor and New Zealand's Next Top Model. He tells Duncan about making all these shows, the importance of casting, the way the New Zealand character feeds into our reality TV and more. If you enjoy this episode, hop over and give The Fold a follow wherever you're listening to this.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Breathwork, balloons and brain juice
items.content:encoded:
The Apprentice Aotearoa's iconic trio of Mike, Ness and Stephen took the plunge into the shark tank to present their business plans to three titans of industry on Monday night – but who avoided Pero’s finger of fate to make it to the final? Also this week: living room week on The Block NZ and a bedroom redo for Alex. Stay tuned for a special Apprentice Aotearoa finale episode of The Real Pod on Wednesday!

items.title: Mowing mishaps and mile-high headboards
items.content:encoded:
This week we dive into the weeds of a gardening challenge and unearth a truly iconic mowing mishap on The Apprentice Aotearoa. The hard labour continues on The Block NZ where the florals are dry, the headboards are high and our teams are battling through master bedroom and ensuite week. Finally, in Married at First Sight Australia news, you’ll never believe what Bryce and Melissa are getting for Christmas 👶👶

items.title: Family bathrooms and tipsy tour buses
items.content:encoded:
It’s family bathroom week on The Block NZ and the cracks are starting to show – actual cracks in Dylan and Keegan’s bathroom and figurative ones in Connie and Rach’s friendship. Meanwhile, on The Apprentice Aotearoa, Teams Tahi and Mana are tasked with giving a gaggle of oldies a terrible bus tour and getting them sozzled in a challenge flog the most plonk. It's a lifestyle!

items.title: Secrets from The Apprentice Aotearoa with Cassie Roma
items.content:encoded:
Entrepreneur, star of The Apprentice Aotearoa and secret The Real Pod listener Cassie Roma is in the studio! She shares some sensational behind-the-scenes scoops from the season’s greatest moments, including Mally the Mallard, Josie the busy mum and the cinematography of Mike Pero’s iconic “you’re fired” point. Team Real Pod then pitches some of our best/worst business ideas – are we hired or fired?

Join Rec Room – a weekly newsletter from The Spinoff full of recommendations of things to watch, read, listen to and eat. Sign up now at thespinoffrecroom.substack.com

Colin tells us some of the wildest gossip he’s heard about himself, explains why influencers will never be celebrities and regales us with stories from the red carpet.
Join Rec Room – a weekly newsletter from The Spinoff full of recommendations of things to watch, read, listen to and eat. Sign up now at thespinoffrecroom.substack.com

items.title: Shocking revelations from The Masked Singer NZ finale
items.content:encoded:
The last three Masked Singers have been unmasked in a finale where the biggest shock was probably how good Jason Kerrison’s hair looked. Great barnet! Meanwhile on The Apprentice Aotearoa, the teams were sent on a cryptic shopping scavenger hunt in what everybody agrees was the best challenge of the season so far.

items.title: Jane of Podtown solves a mystery
items.content:encoded:
While Mare of Easttown has been investigating who did a murder, Jane of Podtown has been investigating who donned a Pavlova. But did she find out before all was revealed on this week’s episode of The Masked Singer NZ? In The Apprentice Aotearoa news, Alex is seeing ghosts of Mally past and Duncan reveals a Greive family hygiene tradition that will probably not surprise you at all.

items.title: Pav is here
items.content:encoded:
Team Real Pod is joined in the studio this week by special guest Pavlova from The Masked Singer NZ! Just the costume, which we’re swabbing for DNA because we still haven’t figured out who it is underneath the mask. Or has it been Jane all along? Also, The Apprentice Aotearoa went to the French Market.

items.title: Drag Race Down Under the Covers | Episode 5
items.content:encoded:
Chris and Eli recap the branding challenge with Rhys Nicholson, the self proclaimed “Santino of Down Under”. Rhys reveals all the behind the scenes goss about filming in a fridge while the trio honour the true queen of NZ: Suzanne Paul. Rounding up this truly revealing episode is a gorgeous and insightful chat with the eliminated queen!

items.title: Justice for Mally the Mallard
items.content:encoded:
Hashtag Team Real Pod recap another brilliantly bonkers episode of The Apprentice Aotearoa in which Hamilton gets a cinematic rebrand and Mally the Mallard gets the stink eye from the mayor. Meanwhile, on The Masked Singer NZ, Orange Roughy and Possum lose their heads to reveal a news-breaking superstar and a Shortland Street sensation.

items.title: A summer robe task and celebs unmasked
items.content:encoded:
Jane, Alex and Duncan are left with more questions than answers from this week's The Apprentice Aotearoa and The Masked Singer NZ episodes. How short is too short when it comes to luxury robes, for example, and could it be Mike McRoberts underneath the (orange roughy) mask? The confusion continues as they speculate on what’s really going on between Lexie and Jack, while a reported sighting of Max Key has them backed into a corner.

Join Rec Room – a weekly newsletter from The Spinoff full of recommendations of things to watch, read, listen to and eat. Sign up now at thespinoffrecroom.substack.com

items.contentSnippet:
Jane, Alex and Duncan are left with more questions than answers from this week's The Apprentice Aotearoa and The Masked Singer NZ episodes. How short is too short when it comes to luxury robes, for example, and could it be Mike McRoberts underneath the (orange roughy) mask? The confusion continues as they speculate on what’s really going on between Lexie and Jack, while a reported sighting of Max Key has them backed into a corner.

items.title: Drag Race Down Under the Covers | Episode 3
items.content:encoded:
Get ready to have your mouth scalded because this week's guest is serving her tea piping hot. Chris Parker and Eli Matthewson are joined by House of Drag star (for four episodes) Medulla Oblongata to decide once and for all if the original music created on Drag Race is actually any good? Plus, the pair catch up with the eliminated queen and deliver some hot off the presses breaking news!

items.title: The Apprentice Aotearoa vs The Masked Singer NZ
items.content:encoded:
Both The Masked Singer and The Apprentice Aotearoa landed this week and team Real Pod couldn’t possibly be more excited. Join Alex, Duncan and Jane in the boardroom as they discuss the very serious business of mostly moot points, then join them onstage as they throw around wild guesses as to who might be behind the masks on our latest reality singing competition.

items.content:encoded:
Chris Parker and Eli Matthewson are joined by the ICONIC Lady Trenyce this week to get stuck into the Drag Race Down Under Snatch Game, where truly only one queen did well. Lady Trenyce has some actual behind the scenes goss to share (spoiler alert: it’s about Murder She Wrote), and we hear from the eliminated queen, who got in full, fabulous drag just for the pod.

items.title: One of the worst greetings we've ever seen
items.content:encoded:
Jane, Alex and Duncan polish off the flog-heavy final reunion episodes of Married at First Sight Australia before picking over the rest of the reality buffet. Popstars, RuPaul’s Drag Race Down Under, The Masked Singer NZ, The Apprentice Aotearoa… what will we gorge ourselves on next? Speaking of, Alex also reports back after living out her Pods-as-cereal fantasy.

–––––

https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/remembering-tavita-karika

Need to talk? Free call or text 1737 any time for support from a trained counsellor.

Lifeline – 0800 543 354

Samaritans – 0800 726 666.

Suicide Crisis Helpline – 0508 828 865 (0508 TAUTOKO).

Depression Helpline – 0800 111 757 or free text 4202.

Healthline – 0800 611 116

Youthline – 0800 376 633, free text 234 or email talk@youthline.co.nz or online chat


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Drag Race Down Under the Covers | Episode 1
items.content:encoded:
Chris Parker and Eli Matthewson are here to recap the first episode of Drag Race Down Under with a very special guest: local legend and star of House of Drag Miss Geena. There's superhero shenanigans, nude illusions and the first drag queen All Black to talk about – plus we get the tea on the behind-the-scenes Caluzzi drama and have an exclusive chat with the eliminated queen! Get under the covers with us, let's talk drag xo

items.title: Bury MAFS AU in a lamington coffin – Popstars is finally getting good
items.content:encoded:
This week, Alex and Jane mourn the death of an unappreciated snack, speculate on Moses Mackay’s brunch date, unmask the guessing panel for The Masked Singer NZ and decide if they’re ready to step into statement Crocs. Plus final vows on Married at First Sight Australia send our hosts into a spin and a surprise visit to Colin’s Cranny asks some serious questions of the funeral industry.

items.title: Announcing Drag Race Down Under the Covers with Chris and Eli
items.content:encoded:
Exciting news: The Real Pod is hosting a new pop-up podcast for the upcoming season of RuPaul’s Drag Race Down Under! It’s called Drag Race Down Under the Covers and it's hosted by our good friends Chris Parker and Eli Mathewson, who'll be joined by an extra special guest from the local drag scene each week to recap the latest episode. In this preview episode, Chris and Eli look at what we can expect when the season premieres on TVNZ on May 1 – to hear more, just stay subscribed to The Real Pod and check back after the first episode!

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: A corny week on The Bachelor NZ
items.content:encoded:
Join Jane, Duncan and special guest Stewart Sowman-Lund as they relive the past week on The Bachelor NZ, including even more water-based dates, tragic back-stories, self-eliminations, a nightmare-inducing talent show, pottery, pole dancing… and at long last, the season’s first pash. There’s also some Real News courtesy of bachelorette Sam, two separate mentions of the Champagne Lady and a Community Noticeboard update from Upper Hutt.

items.title: A VIP meet and greet with The Bachelor NZ
items.content:encoded:
Jane and Duncan are joined by Gone By Lunchtime’s Ben Thomas to recap another week of what might be the least horny season of The Bachelor ever made.


In this episode: Real News reports on a mass Bachelorette sighting in New Plymouth at the weekend, Colin Mathura-Jeffree recounts a hair-raising encounter in Colin’s Cranny and Reality Check relives all the big moments from The Bachelor NZ this week as Annie fake phone calls her way into pole position for the long-awaited first kiss of the season.

items.title: Holy moly guacamole it’s week two of MAFS AU
items.content:encoded:
Join Jane and Alex as they try to decide if the final two couples on Married at First Sight Australia are Hot or Not Hot.


In this episode we discover the results of Alex’s C19 test (2:18) before moving into the marital apartments with Belinda and Patrick (3:55), Rusty and Beth (19:54), Jason and Alana (30:14), Melissa and Bryce (32:38), Booka and Brett (42:47), Jake and Bec (43:07), James and Jo (47:17), Sam and Cam (50:11) and Coco and Sam (54:57).


We’ve got our first dinner party of the year, a sky-high pile of Honesty Boxes, Hot or Not Hot rankings galore... and a huge amount of carrots and peanut butter to get through.

items.title: One sexpert, several baths and many SIM cards – MAFS AU is back, baby
items.content:encoded:
Married At First Sight Australia has hurtled back onto our screens like a glass of wine at a dinner party, and The Real Pod's MAFS-perts Alex Casey and Jane Yee have committed to watching every ep. Crack open your honesty box, settle in with a salad box and join two very excited women in the commentary box for week one, where much like Sam's ankles, the cracks are already beginning to show.

items.title: The Bachelorette NZ pashes and slashes her suitors
items.content:encoded:
Join The Real Pod over Zoom this week as we learn the fate of That Vegan Teacher, discover a shocking fact about MAFS' Nasser and find out the truth about Michelle Visage’s L&P in Real News (3:48). Jane drops a bombshell about Squiggles in this week’s edition of Wayne’s World (12:18), Alex thinks Critter Corner (15:10) might need to find a new name, and we check in on Colin’s Cranny (17:34), the Community Noticeboard (20:12) and Max Key Corner (22:22) before Alex gets muted so the grown-ups can talk The Bachelorette NZ (24:10).

items.title: Bonus episode: MAFS AU reunion recap part one
items.content:encoded:
In this bonus episode of the The Real Pod, Alex and Jane recap part one of the MAFS Australia reunion. Dinner is served and so is the drama as Nasser delivers his final speech, Cyrell loses her cool and her drink (all over Jessika's face) and Troy makes a play for Ashley with the frizzy hair. Join team Real Pod as they unpack it all and make a phone call that leaves them reeling.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Join team Real Pod as they unpack it all and make a phone call that leaves them reeling. Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: The Bachelorette NZ sorts the baby daddies from the boys
items.content:encoded:
Team Real Pod gather around the pod table to bring you the latest in New Zealand reality telly and the stories that didn’t make the 6pm news.


This week: Cats gone wild! Mittens gets kidnapped, Nero rides a train and Milo’s stealing fingerless gloves. In non-cat news, scientists work on the pressing need for veges to send emails, the powers that be in Texas send accidental alerts to the entire state population about a knife-wielding doll, and we finally get to the bottom (sorry) of why Wombats do square poos. 


Plus we recap a week of lads lad lads on The Bachelorette NZ with our New Plymouth correspondent Tara Reid-Ward.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: The Real Pod rides again
items.content:encoded:
We’re back, baby! Jane, Alex and Duncan return to the studio to revive all the classic segments of yore – and review the brand new season of The Bachelorette NZ.


This week: the first Real News in ages includes a furious sex arse tycoon, a tempting sausage, a boy who found $5 in the sea and sold it for $500 and Duncan recalling a Trade Me lemon nightmare. We consider the case for Tourism NZ to reunite Jay Jay and Minou, do a Real Review, return to Colin’s Cranny, check in with Max Key and check out the Community Noticeboard. Then live updates editor Stewart Sowman-Lund joins Jane and Duncan to discuss first impressions of the new season of The Bachelorette NZ.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: The Spinoff presents SUPERPOD 2020
items.content:encoded:
Pour yourself some eggnog and join the hosts of The Spinoff’s podcast network for our annual Superpod round up of the year that was.


Representing Gone By Lunchtime, Dietary Requirements, The Real Pod, Papercuts, The Fold and On The Rag our hosts dive into the key events, issues, heroes and villains of 2020.


From National’s botched election campaign to Ben Thomas’ take on TikTok, via the collapse of Bauer, the rise of oat milk, with a detour through controversial frozen grapes and Simon’s Sausage Spot, there’s something for everyone in this year’s Superpod. Featuring special guests producer T and Covid-19.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: THE TWILIGHT POD
items.content:encoded:
After more than a year of social distancing for Alex, Jane and Duncan, the Real Pod trio are back in the same room for an emotional reunion and the long-awaited analysis of a cinematic masterpiece.


Approximately a thousand years ago, the idea of The Real Pod maybe, possibly, perhaps one day recapping the Twilight movie was floated. The people heard the rally cry, and a small but incredibly insistent movement began.


The comments on Facebook asking “Twilight pod?” kept trickling in, and after the sixth or seventh one, we finally relented. As if we could outrun it... as if we could fight it off.


So here we are in Forks, Washington, diving deep into all the mystery and wonder of an unstoppable love between vampire and human. Join us as we talk 2000s fashion, terrible hair, fast cars, mushroom risotto, twenty-three year old doctor dads and that scene in the parking lot. Plus Alex drops a bombshell about R-Patz that none of us smelt coming. 


It’s The Real Pod, and it’s really, really long. What a stupid pod… What sick, masochistic podcasters.


– Sign up to The Spinoff's newsletter Rec Room for weekly recommendations along with all our latest videos and podcasts.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: The Real Pod: The final pod for the final rose
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod assembles one more time to dissect the final week of The Bachelorette NZ, with special thanks to Nando’s.


We've reached the end of our love journey in more ways than one, as this season of The Bachelorette NZ coincides with end of The Real Pod in it's current form. Lesina chose nobody, Lily chose Richie and Alex, Duncan and Jane have a lot of questions. Why did AMOG wear those shoes on the beach? Why is Lesina's mum a crown prosecutor? And who on Earth is Chad?


Stay tuned to the end for some virtual goodbyes, as well as 12 minutes of Duncan and Alex recapping After the Final Rose in the Uber home from the filming. It’s The Real Pod, and it's been real.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: The Real Pod: Our very first lockdown podcast
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod assembles (virtually) to dissect the penultimate week of The Bachelorette NZ, except this time we are in a national lockdown. 


The lads on The Bachelorette NZ knew all about what it was like to be in lockdown, so in a lot of ways we should have been prepared for this. Coming at you via our individual houses on day one of national lockdown, we have no choice to return to doing what we do best: recapping reality television.


It was hometown week on The Bachelorette NZ, back when domestic travel was encouraged and hugging was a normal way of greeting people. Logan's Mum was incredible, AMOG's Dad spilled all and Jesse's brother seemed to be gunning for The Bachelor NZ in 2021. Join us for a little bit of normalcy in a weird, weird world.


And remember: stay inside and watch telly.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: The Real Pod: Escaping into The Bachelorette NZ and Logan's scary notebook
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod reassembles to dissect the seventh week of The Bachelorette NZ, with special thanks to Nando’s.


The good news is that we are all back in the same country for the first time in a long time, the bad news is that it is definitely not because of The Right Reasons. In a snap decision, Jane left LAX for New Zealand 48 hours ago and recaps her journey home for us in these freaky times of Covid-19.


It's a better time than ever to travel to our alternate reality in Argentina, where the boys are still pulling down pants and popping grapes willy-nilly. Mike and Michael decided they were done with Lesina's grilling, Logan had a revealing session with his notebook and AMOG has come completely loose at the seams.

It's The Real Pod, and it's still real. For now.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
items.content:encodedSnippet:
The Real Pod reassembles to dissect the seventh week of The Bachelorette NZ, with special thanks to Nando’s.

The good news is that we are all back in the same country for the first time in a long time, the bad news is that it is definitely not because of The Right Reasons. In a snap decision, Jane left LAX for New Zealand 48 hours ago and recaps her journey home for us in these freaky times of Covid-19.

It's a better time than ever to travel to our alternate reality in Argentina, where the boys are still pulling down pants and popping grapes willy-nilly. Mike and Michael decided they were done with Lesina's grilling, Logan had a revealing session with his notebook and AMOG has come completely loose at the seams.
It's The Real Pod, and it's still real. For now.

 Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: The Real Pod: Join us in the gratitude circle of The Bachelorette NZ
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod reassembles to dissect the sixth week of The Bachelorette NZ, with special thanks to Nando’s.


In this trying times of global chaos and social distancing, we welcome you to join our digital gratitude circle and recap the last week on The Bachelorette NZ. These were happier times when the swimming was synchronised, the chicken nibbles were realistic looking and Michael's root vegetable was hanging out for all the world to see.


AMOG has completely come undone, Jesse is permanently rarked and Liam is officially veto-ed. In real news, Duncan played Alex's Mum at Scrabble and got caned, Jane is in the thick of California Coronavirus chaos and Alex is wearing a wig. We also desperately have to talk about whatever the hell is going on with MAFS AU. It's The Real Pod, and it's real as hell.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: The Real Pod: The Bachelorette NZ moves to Big Dad's farm
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod reassembles to dissect the fifth week of The Bachelorette NZ, with special thanks to Nando’s.


The boys have escaped jail for the Argentinian countryside this week, complete with rabbit hunting and a whole lot of prickles. Steve tries to serenade his way to a kiss, Liam goes on a jean short journey and Mike finally lets down those handsome walls. Logan is writing a rom-com, Jesse is writing poetry and Michael is still trying to write the perfect cake recipe.


On the pod, things are evolving too. Duncan has changed his mind (again) about Richie, Jane needs to go to hospitable with a chronic case of missing Tavita-itis and Alex has some more feelings about eggs. It's The Real Pod and it's about as real as it gets.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: The Real Pod: In which we deeply respect the culture of The Bachelorette NZ
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod reassembles to dissect the cultured fourth week of The Bachelorette NZ with special thanks to Nando’s.


This week on The Bachelorette NZ, a burrito bust-up ends in anaphylaxis, Steve chows down on some one ply and the Buenos Aires hostel goes full Lord of the Flies. It's become abundantly clear that that the show is less about two women finding love, and more about a bunch of blokes slowly losing their mind over a talking bottle.


Also Duncan makes a formal apology to Richie, Jane reveals her drop crotch truth and there is a fierce debate about visible farts vs poop burps. Oh, there's also a bit of a bombshell from Alex. It's The Real Pod and, today, it's real as hell.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: The Real Pod: The awkies intruders hit The Bachelorette NZ
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod reassembles to dissect the fourth week of The Bachelorette NZ with special thanks to Nando’s.


Oi oi me homies, it's intruder week on The Bachelorette NZ and we are about as shook as a humble kūmara being wrenched from Dargaville's finest soil. Michael! Mac! Mike! Richie! Elliott (again)! The lad culture in the mansion is officially ruined, the cat has been set amongst the pigeons and all Aaron can do is sing his favourite Lonestar tune.

Lesina took Elliott out for a danger cruise, Lily made gelato with Liam and the boys pranked each other till the stars turned cold. Will Steve ever forgive Aaron for interrupting him? Will Logan's kissing ever get better? And how long until Tavita's hernia explodes all over the Buenos Aires?? All that, and a quick round-up of MAFS AU and Love is Blind. It's The Real Pod!


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: The Real Pod: The Bachelorette gets naked, teary and herniated in Argentina
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod reassembles to dissect the nude and rude third week of The Bachelorette NZ with special thanks to Nando’s.


Two wonderful women and a mixed bag of lads jetted off to Argentina this week, one which saw a serious culling of the meek set of the herd. Conor, Flynn and Mr Wedge all departed, nearly joined by Tavita, who was only saved after his hernia was given a double shaka down at the hospitable.


The big change at the 'actually plausible winners' end of the competition was Aaron disintegrating before our wide eyes. First he snitched on Steve for his hobby of the odd sly dart, then he did a diary cam in maybe the worst possible location in their mansion/prison, then he fell apart in ways which we found either endearing or terrifying. Alex, Jane and Duncan recount every wild moment, with a little recap of the first few MAFS AU weddings for dessert. Delicious, like a block of fresh gouda.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: The Real Pod: The Bachelorette NZ lads find love... with each other
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod reassembles to dissect the second week of The Bachelorette NZ with special thanks to Nando’s.

The dramatic second week began with Lily walking in to the mansion and ended with The Mole revealing his true moley self to the bewildered men. Will the twists ever stop? Maybe everyone is a mole! The only thing we're sure of is that Glenn has continued to be weird and Aaron has continued to showcase a range of hats.

In the mansion, things are starting to get interesting and strong feelings are starting to form. Tavita has declared he would "go to war" with Marc, Liam has a gratitude circle for his birthday and Logan, Kurt and Jonathan compose an original song together. Oh yeah, and Lily and Lesina are there too.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.content:
The Real Pod reassembles to dissect the second week of The Bachelorette NZ with special thanks to Nando’s.
The dramatic second week began with Lily walking in to the mansion and ended with The Mole revealing his true moley self to the bewildered men. Will the twists ever stop? Maybe everyone is a mole! The only thing we're sure of is that Glenn has continued to be weird and Aaron has continued to showcase a range of hats.
In the mansion, things are starting to get interesting and strong feelings are starting to form. Tavita has declared he would "go to war" with Marc, Liam has a gratitude circle for his birthday and Logan, Kurt and Jonathan compose an original song together. Oh yeah, and Lily and Lesina are there too.

items.title: The Real Pod: In which The Bachelorette NZ blows us all away
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod reassembles to dissect the first week of The Bachelorette NZ with special thanks to Nando’s.

Blow your air horns and distress your jeans, the very first week of The Bachelorette NZ is over and we are absolutely amping. Join us as we recap the Tough Mudder group date, the romantic single dates up trees and on seas, and all the ways this season is throwing convention to the wind.

Two Bachelorettes? No date cards? Live-in host? We love to see it. It's not all roses though as the podcast is torn apart on several issues. Team Glenn or Team Marc? Is Tavita here for the right reasons? And who went crazy on the Roman blinds? It's The Real Pod, and it is real as hell.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

items.title: The Real Pod: Art Green dissects episode one of The Bachelorette NZ
items.content:encoded:
In this very special episode of The Real Pod, Art Green joins us to yarn about The Bachelorette NZ premiere. Brought to you by our friends at Nandos. 


It's been five years in the making, but we finally got Art Green on our podcast. Joining us fresh out of episode one of The Bachelorette NZ, we recap every inch of the premiere from first arrivals to cocktail tensions. He tells us just how cold it was when Lesina met the lads, which guys were full-blown pick-up artists and flags some extreme nudity coming down the pipe. He also answers the big questions: Who is there for the right reasons? What is Elliott like in real life? And how's the extreme alpha dog energy?


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: The Real Pod: New year, new decade, same old pod
items.content:encoded:
The Real Pod assembles to dissect the summer in reality television and real life, with special thanks to Nando’s.


We're ba-ack! After a long cruel summer full of Jay Jay and Minou heartbreak, The Bachelorette NZ reveals and a mild case of ring worm, there is much to discuss. Why has Breakfast returned more sexed-up than ever? Will we ever see Minou again? And will Alex deliver on her shooey promises?


Beyond that, there's also the much-anticipated finale of New Zealand's Next Top Model from 2009. We're not going to say it's an anti-climax, but we are going to say that the highlight is definitely Colin Mathura-Jeffree pelting young models with lamingtons for no reason. That's The Real Pod way.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: The Real Pod: In which Trev is the icing on the cake
items.content:encoded:
Spend your relaxing Boxing Day unboxing the Great Kiwi Bake Off finale with us. It was a Christmas-themed episode stacked with surprises, meringues and exploding tarts. But of course, most important of all is the fact that our ex-Navy ironman Trev came away with the trotie.


There's also the penultimate episode of New Zealand's Next Top Model, where Wendyl Nissen drags the models to filth, a Nivea challenge brings out some performance blemishes and Michael Hill's boat makes a cameo appearance. It's The Real Pod, and we'll see you in 2020.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
